main event: On October 16, 1955, witnesses observed a blue lighted disc that made loops and emitted a sound similar to an electric motor.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only about 0.5 seconds., Multiple witnesses reported seeing a cylindrical object approximately 50 to 60 feet long and 8 to 10 feet in diameter., The object was illuminated by a bright, bluish-green light that appeared to be emitted from it., Investigators concluded that the sighting may have been due to the noise of a diesel-electric locomotive, as no object was confirmed by multiple sources., The reliability of the witnesses was questioned, with suggestions of overactive imagination leading to the misidentification of the object.
witness description: Both witnesses were described as a commercial pilot and a heavy equipment operator with technical knowledge.
